'''Fladweth Amrod''' was a place in [[Tol Eressëa]] near [[Tavrobel]], where [[Eriol]] stayed temporarily, according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] associated with ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref>{{PE|11}}, p. 35</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Fladweth Amrod'' is [[Gnomish]] for "Nomad's Green",<ref>{{LT2|Appendix}}, entry "Ladwen-na-Dhaideloth"</ref> being a compound of ''[[fladweth]]'' ("meadow, grassland") + ''[[amrog]]'' ("nomad, wanderer").<ref name="Green">{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3762460739.html|articlename=G. ''Fladweth Amrod'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=3 April 2022}}</ref>

Another, earlier, name for the place was '''''Fladweth-amrog'''''.<ref>{{PE|11}}, p. 19</ref>

== Inspiration ==
In the spring of [[1918]], [[Tolkien]] was posted again to Rugeley Camp, in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penkridge Penkridge], a village in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Staffordshire Staffordshire]. While visiting him, [[Edith Bratt]], and several of her companions, found accommodation in a nearby house in Gipsy Green, a small hamlet. There, Tolkien would occasionally visit them and stay for a while.<ref name="Gib">{{CG|I}}, Entry on the year [[1918]], p. 112</ref>

It is possible that the name of ''Gipsy Green'' may be reflected in the name ''Fladweth Amrod'' (whose translation from Gnomish would be ''Nomad's Green''),<ref name="Gib"/> a connection [[John Garth]] proposed in his book ''[[Tolkien and the Great War]]''.<ref>{{CG|I}}, "Notes", Note on the entry on Spring (?May) [[1918]], p. 837</ref>
